actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to authorize the minting of coins to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the founding of the United Nations in New York City, New York.
short_title: United Nations 50th Anniversary Commemorative Coin Act of 1995

summary.text: United Nations 50th Anniversary Commemorative Coin Act of 1995 - Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to issue five-dollar gold coins and one-dollar silver coins emblematic of the United Nations, to include the three opening words of the United Nations Charter, "We the peoples." Mandates that all surcharges received from coin sales be paid to the United Nations Association of the United States of America.

titles.title: United Nations 50th Anniversary Commemorative Coin Act of 1995
A bill to authorize the minting of coins to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the founding of the United Nations in New York City, New York.
